1.text: And I determined this to myself, not to come to you again in sadness.

2.text: For if I grieve you, and who is he making me glad, except he being grieved by me.

3.text: And I wrote this same to you lest, coming, I should have sadness from whom I ought to rejoice, trusting to you all, that mine is the joy of you all.

4.text: For out of much pressure and anxiety of heart I wrote to you through many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love I have more abundantly towards you.

5.text: And if any have grieved, he has not grieved me, but by part; that I might not overload you all.

6.text: Sufficient to such a one this enjoyment of the esteem of the many.

7.text: So that on the contrary ye should rather show kindness, and console, lest perhaps such be swallowed down with more abundant sadness.

8.text: Wherefore I beseech you to confirm love to him.

9.text: For, for this I also wrote, that I might know the proof of you, if ye are obedient for all things.

10.text: And to whom ye show any favor; I also: for also if I have shown any kindness, to whom I have shown kindness, through you in the face of Christ;

11.text: That we might not be taken advantage of by Satan: for we are not ignorant of his inventions.

12.text: And coming to Troas for the good news of Christ, and a door having been opened to me in the Lord,

13.text: I have had no relaxation to my spirit, in my not finding Titus my brother: but having taken leave of them, I went out to Macedonia.

14.text: Grace to God, always leading us to triumph in Christ, and making manifest the order of his knowledge by us in every place.

15.text: For we are to God a sweet odor of Christ, in the saved, and in the host:

16.text: Truly to those an odor of death into death; and to those an odor of life into life. And who sufficient for these things?

17.text: For we are not as the many adulterating the word of God: but as of purity, but as of God, before the face of God speak we in Christ.
